sourceOfFunds.purpose: Cultivation and Conservation of Timaru and Kapoor Kachari for the socio economic Development of Rural poor and BPL women of Chamoli Garhwal.

The project was sanctioned under the Jila Nawachar Nidhi pariyojana . Under this project we have developed local unknown trekking routes of Chamoli garhwal and developed few bamboo huts for promotion of Ecotourism in Himalaya . We have established a Biotourism park at Pipalkoti Chamoli and few Home stay on Panchkedar trekking route,

We will plant the Bamboo in the vicinity of the houses of the artisans using the concept of backyard garden, so that the artisans can utilise them when needed or when they run short of Ringaal. This also reduces the pressure on the natural forest for raw material, decrease ecological imbalance and drudgery. This also rebinds the emotional attachment with the forest and natural resources within or in the periphery of village ecosystem.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: Uttarakhand Bamboo and Fiber Development board
sourceOfFunds.purpose: Earlier all degumming/processing of Natural Fiber was successfully organized in Ajeevika Vatika Pipalkoti. Pipalkoti was an ideal center for degumming activities, processing of fiber and storage because of its accessibility .

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: All India Centre For Urban And Rural Development(AICURD); State Unit Uttarakhand. AICURD is a national level organization, we are an established non-governmental voluntary organization working various parts of India since 1985, we are registered under society registration 1860 had registered in Delhi. We working in Uttarakhand since 2012 as a AICURD; state unit Uttarakhand on grass root level. Our state office located at Pithoragrah town. AICURD, consistently been pursuing its aim to improve quality of life of marginalized sections of population through community based programs of poverty elevation and socioeconomic empowerment with added attention towards elementary education, health and training for income generation activities. Currently AICURD; state unit Uttarakhand is working on education and livelihood in Okhalkanda block of Nainital district. NABARD is funding to AICURD; State unit Uttarakhand for the formations of women SHG. In the field of education we are running computer training institute voluntary at remote and rural area of Okhalkanda block, where we are providing free computer education to poor students who belongs to BPL and weaker sections. With the computer literacy, we are providing those students English speaking and personality development course too and also give tuition to poor. During the course we put career counseling program from the professionals. We had put carrier counseling program at remote area of Pithoragrah and Bageshwar district in the past. We have been continuously working for sustainable development of environment and hilly people dependent on local resources. In the process we have already benefited/trained more than 2000 beneficiaries through different plans and projects in the area of Bageshwar, Pithoragrah, Almora and Nainital district.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Our Society has set up two Physio-therapy Age Care Centers in Mussoorie. One Senior Citizen Day Care Center has been setup to combat isolation, poverty and deprivation of elderly people in Mussoorie.The Society has been organising free Medical and Health Checkup camps to create awareness about the diseases afflicting Senior Citizens and General Public such as Crdio vascullar diseaes, joint pains eyes illments, loss of hearing adds etc. The Society has been organising Yoga Campus for five days and celebrating International Yoga Day after our honlble Prime Minister has got international recognisation to Yoga on 21st June for the Last Two Years. Members of the Society undertake voluntory teaching in Mahatma Yogeswar Sarswati Vidya Mandir and Kendriya Vidyalay LBSNAA. The Society distributes woolen garments, Blankets, Shoes etc to the needy persons including school going childrens in Government Schools. The Society celebrates International Day against Abuse of Elders on 15th June and International Senior Citizens Day on 1st Oct. We provide legal knowledge and assistance to the elders about the rights granted to them under The Maintenance of Parents and Senior Citizens Act and Rules and fight for their rights, dignity and respect granted to them under The Constitution and law of the land.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The Society is run with the help of Membership Fees of Rs.500/- for Life Membership , and Rs. 200/- Annual Membership fee by the Members , Plus Donations are given by the members, Youngsters, Friends and Relations. In addition, Fee of Rs.50 is collected per sitting from the patients who can affords two Physiotherapy Centers run by The Association

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Organisation is dedicated for the development of physically challenged persons of Uttarakhand. 5 health camps were conducted with cooperation of hospitals for the health check up of differently able. 290 equipment were distributed. 165 differently able persons were provided vocational training like candle making,agarbatti making,dona-pattal making,tailoring and computer course. Now 135 differently able persons are earning for their families and no more depending on their families.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The president of our organization is Mr. Bhopal Singh Rawat is 100% blind person; he had been working since thirteen years for the complete development of disabled persons of Uttarakhand. His main aim is to make the poor disabled self-reliant so that they may be recognized as prominent persons in the society and also an earning members in their families. So far no funds have been received by the society from government society is generating funds by its own and with the help of other disabled.

ngoList.title: Appropriate Technology India
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Promotion of 2119 SHGs with a membership of more than 16000 poor women. Reaching 18323 households of 827 remotest mountain villages of 5 districts of Uttarakhand with sustainable livelihood programs. Facilitating the first community owned micro-finance institution called Ushamath Mahila Mahasangh Ltd (UMM) to serve the financial needs most needy and underprivileged segment of community in remote hill villages of Himalayan mountain state Ukhand. Organizing 23 Farmers Producer Organizations (FPOs) / Livelihood Collectives (LCs) and building their capacity to act as an institution of small and disadvantaged farmers to resolve the issues in production and marketing collectively. Securing the first organic certification for 3861 beekeepers and moving the subsistence level barter honey production to business level; currently being traded by DNPPCL-the producers company under the brand DevBhumi as organic certified honey. The certification is being extended to honey producers in collaboration with Uttarakhand Organic Certification Agency (USOCA) Creation of the state of art production and processing facilities in sericulture sector such as 206 silk worm rearing houses, 2 Grainage houses, 1 Chawaki rearing houses, 120 decentralized silk yarn spinning facilities, 1 mulberry silk reeling units, 8 handloom weaving centers and 1 dyeing center. The chain involves over 1000 households in terms of silk based livelihood who now earns in the range of Rs. 3000-15000 across the silk value chains. Moving the subsistence based dairy to commercially viable activities with 6395 poor mountain women. The sector generate a revenue of Rs. 1564 lakh per annum. Developing more than 150 Business Development Services (BDS) in 5 mountain districts in dairy sector by building skills / capacity of rural youths to extend inputs and out services on commercial basis. Initiating decentralized spices processing facilities at 4 different locations in Uttarakhand to assist and develop skills among more than 5206 organic spices producers to fully act in organic spices value chain. The decentralized processing facilities help producers to reduce transport cost and ensure quality production of spices. Creation of forest of economically and ecologically significant plant species such as Quercus serrrata (Oak), Bamboo, local fodder species and mulberry etc. on 860 hectare land in Uttarakhand. Finding utilization aspects of an invasive weeds called Eupatorium. The weeds is tenacious and is a direct threat to the environment as it destroy the forest and agriculture land. AT India has been converting this weeds in to natural dye in participation of local community.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Bagwan Gramodhyog Samiti Uttarakhand (BGSUK) is voluntary organization working in the remote and inaccessible parts of the district Dehradun and focuses on awareness and establishes the community for their long term sustainable development .In all its programs the organization acts merely facilitator to the development process utilizing local resources, local skills and local knowledge through local initiatives. Experience has shown that this approach is not only cost effective but also ensures sustainability. Another approach of BGS is to increase the linkages between the communities and the Government programs such that benefits Government run services reach the marginalized groups instead of creating parallel structure, which run alongside the government programs. The organization has competences in many technologies like Bamboo Craft, Lantana Craft, Medicinal and Aromatic Plants Cultivation, Food Processing, Bee Keeping, Mushroom Cultivation, Integrated Farming, Organic Composting and currently other running programs etc. currently the organization is running many crche centers. Generating awareness camps and condenses courses funded by Central Social Welfare Board. The organization is also working closely with LIC of India under the Micro-Insurance Program (By LIC of India Ltd), which is being run by the voluntary organizations only. BGS in its present year of implementation has always proved its worth and have maintained its position among the top first organization and last three year organization also feels its social responsibility and in lieu of this the organization is supporting Accidental Insurance (Authorized By United India Insurance), Vaccination (Supported By Research India) program in remote and inaccessible blocks namely Chakrata and Kalsi of District Dehradun with Research India, a Lucknow based organization. BGS now MOU with K. L. Polytechnic Roorkee Uttarakhand for Six Month Certificate course Like Instrumental, Nursery Rising, Computer, Electrician, Electronics, Garments Making, Food Preservation etc. for Uttarakhand Unemployed civilians. BGS Organized Certificate Course in Food Preservation with Himachal Consultancy Organization Limited (HIMCON) & Central Government of India. BGS is also currently implementing SHGs formation programme with the help of NABARD, Dehradun in Sahaapur block of the district. BGS is an active partner of HESCO, Dehradun, a leading voluntary organization of the area run by Dr. Anil Prakash Joshi, PADAMSHREE. It has played an important role in implementing various programs in the area. The organization with support of HESCO conducted many training programs for the local community in the terrorist prone area of Uri, Baramulla, and Rajauri, Kargi etc. of J&k with active support of Indian Army. These programs mainly focused on various income generating activities like Food Processing, Candle and Dhoop Making etc. the organization also working closely with HESCO under the Micro-Finance Program (Kissan Bank by HESCO), the organization in past having taken ten days of intensive training and skill development course under SGSY through IAMR on behalf of CAPART, New Delhi. Bagwan Gramodhyog Samiti is working closely with the farmers of the area and having its presence in the area for last once decade, the organization has been awarded by the reputed Forest Research Institute(FRI), Dehradun to develop a model village first of its kind in India , for the same a MOU has been signed between them regarding the training of the local villagers and technology transfer. The Institute is also providing a mother nursery cum playhouse for the demonstration of various technologies in the area. Apart from these many groups from leading organization like FRI, Handi craft, Bamboo Board, LIC, CAPART, DST, DBT, CFTRI, KVIC, IAMR and local organization with many foreign national from Switerzerland, Nepal, USA, South Africa, Zimbabwe, Newzealand, Netherlands etc. have also visited the center. The commonwealth team consisting of many international personalities has also visited the center in 2007.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Our NGO have a vision to save child, save village and save nature.For save child we have established an english medium school which is the only english medium school in that region.we also have established an institute for higher education which includes certificate courses of computers. We also participated in national digital literacy mission and enroll 96 students. If we talk about saving village, because of better education the migration of villagers stopped who tend to take their kids to cities for higher education.We also run social awareness programs by doing theaters, nukad natak.We also organise medical camps for eye care, dental and other on regular intervals. We are also working in a field of woman empowerment, we are giving free swing training to the girls or ladies and help them to create there own source of income.We have given employment to more then 30 people directly if we talk about saving nature then every year we plant new tree and last year we have plant more then 100 plants on the road ends to avoid land slide.
